text: Jordan Peele (born February 21, 1979) is an American actor, comedian, director, producer and writer. Peele directed and wrote the 2017 horror movie Get Out, for which he won an Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay. ==Early Life== Peele was born on February 21, 1979, in New York City and raised by a single mother on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. He graduated from the Calhoun School and attended Sarah Lawrence College in Yonkers, New York. He dropped out of college after two years to pursue comedy. ==Career== Peele joined the cast of the sketch comedy show MADtv in 2003. He became friends with fellow cast member Keegan Michael-Key. The two became a comedy duo, and later co-starred in their own sketch show, Key & Peele. As Filmmaker Year Title Director Writer Producer Distribution Note 2016 Keanu Warner Bros.
